objtitle.title: Sketch of Figures Under a Yoke

objdescid.compdate: c. 1780-85The date is based on stylistic considerations.

provenance.name: British Museum
provenance.note: Acquired at an unknown time by John Deffett Francis and given by him to the British Museum in Dec. 1874.

repository.addressline: Email, Department of Prints and Drawings: prints@britishmuseum.org

desc.objtitle:
Sketch of Figures Under a Yoke,
object 1 (Butlin 82 verso)

objnote.p: For the recto monochrome wash drawing of the same basic design, more fully developed, see Butlin 82 recto, Three Figures Under a Yoke with Two Children.

illustration.illusobjdesc: Four adults and one child stand facing forward in a horizontal arrangement. Depicted in the greatest detail, the central figure wears a long gown (and perhaps a hat or hood?) and bends both arms behind its back. At far left, a gowned adult figure turns its head to look down and right with arms extended and touching in front of its torso. To the immediate right of this figure, the head of a small child is visible. On the right side of the composition, two gowned adult figures also appear to bend their arms behind their backs. The rightmost figure may have its right leg extended. A slightly curved horizontal line at the shoulder level of three adults (excluding the figure far right) suggests the yoke more fully represented in the monochrome wash drawing on the recto of this leaf.

component.illusobjdesc: Four adults and one child stand facing forward in a horizontal arrangement. Depicted in the greatest detail, the central figure who bends slightly forward wears a long gown (and perhaps a hat or hood?) and bends both arms behind its back. The figure's eyes may be closed or at least lowered.

Four adults and one child stand facing forward in a horizontal arrangement. At far left, a gowned adult figure bends forward and turns its head to face down with arms extended downward and touching in front of its torso.
Four adults and one child stand facing forward in a horizontal arrangement. To the immediate right of the leftmost figure, the head of a small child is visible.

Four adults and one child stand facing forward in a horizontal arrangement. The second figure from the right wears a long gown and perhaps a hat or hood. He or she appears to bend both arms behind its back.

Four adults and one child stand facing forward in a horizontal arrangement. The rightmost figure wears a long gown and appears to bend both arms behind its back. He or she may extend its right leg forward.

A slightly curved horizontal line at the shoulder level of three adults (excluding the figure far right) suggests the yoke more fully represented in the monochrome wash drawing on the recto of this leaf.
